required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Complementary and Alternative Care in Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM) in Multiple Sclerosis. A Prospective Observational Study of a CAM-using Cohort

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational study designed to describe disease progression, symptom change, quality of life, diet and lifestyle habits, and frequency of adverse events among patients with multiple sclerosis (MS) who use complementary and alternative medicine (CAM). In addition to describing the patterns of CAM use, this study will also identify and describe the positive deviants, those individuals with the highest quality of life and least amount of disease activity. Positive deviants will be compared to controls in order to describe medication, diet, and lifestyle patterns associated with a lack of MS disease progression and high quality of life.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: This survey has been developed to identify the complementary and alternative therapies most commonly used by individuals with MS. Results will be reported with descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.description: The EDSS will be used to capture disease severity and rates of progression in this cohort.

other_outcome.description: This outcome measure will be used to assess general health and well-being in this CAM using cohort.

arm_group.description: Individuals who are using CAM therapies adjunctively or in lieu of conventional therapy (including, but not limited to, special diets, exercise, meditation, prayer, support groups, herbal therapies, counseling, etc.)

study_pop.textblock: Any individual with multiple sclerosis is invited to participate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of multiple sclerosis (including relapsing remitting MS, secondary progressive MS, primary progressive MS, clinically isolated syndromes (CIS), radiologically-isolated syndromes (RIS), possible MS, or probable MS.
- Age 18-100
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to read/write in English
- Inability or unwillingness to complete survey every six (6) months. (~ 45 min)
